Class Dish

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.eiei.mycookerynotes.Dish

extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents dish object with all the characteristics of it

    • Field Detail

      • dishDescription

        private java.lang.String dishDescription
        Stores dish's description. Default value is "def_description"

      • dishFolderPath

        private java.nio.file.Path dishFolderPath
        Stores dis dir path

      • dishImage

        private javax.swing.JLabel dishImage
        An image of the dish. All dishes have default image on creation with DefaultImages.getDefaultDishImage(Dish) method

      • dishTitle

        private java.lang.String dishTitle
        A title of the dish. Default value is "Новое блюдо"

      • id

        private int id
        An id of the dish

      • inFavourites

        private boolean inFavourites
        Boolean value of is the dish in the user's favourites or not. Default value is false

      • receiptsList

        public java.util.ArrayList<Receipt> receiptsList
        An array that stores a receipts for a dish

    • Method Detail

      • deleteThisDish

        public boolean deleteThisDish()
        This method erases dish's folder with all the receipts and other information and deletes it from MrChef.ReceiptList and MrChef.FavouriteList, if present
        Returns:
        true if dish dir was detected in user's storage and false if not

      • getDishDescription

        public java.lang.String getDishDescription()
        Returns description of the dish
        Returns:
        a value of dishDescription filed

      • getDishFolderPath

        public java.nio.file.Path getDishFolderPath()
        Returns a singleton instance of dishFolderPath, the path to a current folder with a dish's data
        Returns:
        a path to a dish's current folder

      • getDishImage

        public javax.swing.JLabel getDishImage()
        Returns current dish image. If user hasn't set any by himself, returns default dish's image in JLabel
        Returns:
        a JLabel with the dish image

      • getDishTitle

        public java.lang.String getDishTitle()
        Returns current dish title
        Returns:
        the value of dishTitle field

      • getId

        public int getId()
        Gets the dish's id

      • isInFavourites

        public boolean isInFavourites()
        Returns true or false if dish is to be in favourites or not.
        Returns:
        the value of isInFavourites() field

      • renameDishFolder

        public void renameDishFolder​(java.lang.String name)
        When renaming a dish it is necessary to rename a dish folder also. This method renames a dish's folder
        Parameters:
        name - new String name for dish's folre

      • setDishDescription

        public void setDishDescription​(java.lang.String dishDescription)
        Sets the dish's description with a new description
        Parameters:
        dishDescription - new dish description as a String value

      • setDishFolderPath

        public void setDishFolderPath​(java.nio.file.Path dishFolderPath)
        Sets the folder to store the data of a dish
        Parameters:
        dishFolderPath - a path to a dish folder

      • setDishTitle

        public void setDishTitle​(java.lang.String dishTitle)
        Sets or renames dish
        Parameters:
        dishTitle - string value of a new dish title

      • setId

        public void setId​(int id)
        Sets the dish's id with an int
        Parameters:
        id - an int id value

      • setId

        public void setId​(java.lang.String id)
        Sets an id of the dish with a string value
        Parameters:
        id - a string id value

      • setInFavourites

        public void setInFavourites​(boolean inFavourites)
        Sets the value of isInFavourites(). If true, adds a dish to the MrChef.FavouriteList if it's not already there. If false, removes dish from the MrChef.FavouriteList if it's there.
        Parameters:
        inFavourites - true or false if dish is to be in favourites or not

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Represents the dish and it's receipts as a text. Is used to save the dish to a .txt files on a current stage of development. DO NOT change here anythyng until the alternative save/load methods for this programm.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a text representation of the dish and it's receipts
